website_summaries.verdict: With it's sleek, eye catching design, and strong Bluetooth connectivity, the MCR-B043 is a quality addition to any room.
pros: Available in black, blue, white, and red
Sound is clear and easily fills the room

customer_reviews.title: Lasted Less Than A year
customer_reviews.text: Just what I needed, not plastic junk, compact and very good sound. Very easy setup, good am-fm radio reception. Purchased October 2017. August 2018 will not read CDs.
customer_reviews.author: Honest E

customer_reviews.title: Excellent desktop stereo!
customer_reviews.text: This is the third desktop stereo I have tried and, believe me, it is the best. You can adjust the treble, mid, and bass, the balance between speakers and preset stations. I was able to adjust the sound quality to obtain more treble which I could not do on the others. Sound is excellent for such a small system. An added feature I like is the headphone jack is on the front, not the back. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Karen M. Osgood

customer_reviews.title: This audio is a great size for a shelf system in our bedroom
customer_reviews.text: This audio is a great size for a shelf system in our bedroom. The sound is very good and gives the flexibility to play CD's, MP3, or AM/FM. It's a single cd player but perfect for the right music while laying in bed. It rivals the sound of our Bose sound dock I was using for ipod, but now I can also plug in a cd; plus my wife can listen to radio while getting ready in the morning.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: I wish the sound was better, but its OK
customer_reviews.text: Quality system. I wish the sound was better, but its OK. CD sounds fairly good. Bluetooth is version 3 instead of 4 and thus sound is somewhat compressed. Not terrible, but noticeable compared to the CD. Radio sounds OK with the tuner of fairly good sensitivity.
customer_reviews.author: J. Smigatron

customer_reviews.title: Great sound and versatility.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent sound quality. Nice deep bass. Adjustable EQ. Blutooth works well. Usb worked well charging my Ipad and also canbe used to listen to recorded music on USB device. Attractive compact footprint. This unit replaces a failed Boston Acoustics...SOOO much better than that one! Good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Arlene Love

customer_reviews.title: cd player jams
customer_reviews.text: beware. it's a nice system, good sound, fits well anywhere. now, two and a half months after i bought it, which means a month and a half after the return period has expired, there is a cd permanently stuck inside the cd player. it won't eject, no matter what i do. forcing it out with a paper clip or set of tweezers will of course render the cd player inoperable. did i get a one of a kind, fluke clinker? i don't know, but the money is wasted. i'm left with only a radio. i didn't expect something so shoddy from yamaha.
customer_reviews.author: smit

customer_reviews.title: So Good I Bought Two.
customer_reviews.text: After using this sound system for 6 months I liked it so well I bought a second one for a different room. Sound is big and clear, easily fills large living room. I like the easy to see large volume knob. I especially like there is both an Audio plug input AND Bluetooth. Getting both in one unit is hard to find. The remote is easy to see and use. I get compliments from friends on the trendy modern color, much better than black. Box and speaker size fits well on standard bookshelf and also next to other equipment in my TV stand. I like it!
customer_reviews.author: Chris Wilde

customer_reviews.title: Nothing special

customer_reviews.author: dml

customer_reviews.title: weak speakers spoil a great receiver
customer_reviews.text: A disappointment. This unit is not desktop audio quality. I would put it more in the high-end clock radio category. Others have said the speaker are tinny, but I think that they just lack depth, fidelity and volume. I get as good a sound from my little DKnight blue tooth speaker! The controls on the main receiver unit are great: simple and easy to see and operate. That was a main reason for my purchase. But the receiver deserves better speakers than what Yamaha decided to add on. I believe it is time to update and upgrade this little system, Yamaha, if you plan to compete in this audio category.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Kelley

customer_reviews.title: Really nice sound not overwhelming but you can't have a conversation near it at full volume

So no issues with bluetooth connection, CD funtions, or th radio except reception, but I'm in a valley of sorts. So yeah they all do it here lol. So time will tell about sustainability. So I bought this in December and the CD player, like other reviewers, is failing to load and eject the disk....so I had a 5 star review but never posted it but my first impressions are posted. Still sounds good i have time receiver paired with new speakers.....the originals failed.....bass killed them

My old JVC had excellent radio reception using a simple chrome antenna, better sound than the Yamaha, with no annoying 5 second delay for system to turn on. Sometimes analog is better.

customer_reviews.title: Wow!

The sound is full, the bass rich. Listening to my iTunes library from my iPhone is amazing. Pairing took a second, so easy. And now I have a great CD player again for my library of CDs collected over the years. I almost want another Yamaha Micro Component System for my office

This is definitely a recommended purchase for smaller living spaces such as bedrooms, home offices, kitchens or the aforementioned larger bathroom.
